name: NPR
text:
A group of 6 U.S. mayors have penned a letter to Congress asking that it pass legislation to block the Trump administration from deploying federal agents to cities without their officials' consent.
https://t.co/XrmqB8mMGS

name: NPR
text:
The U.N. says it will provide temporary housing units for asylum seekers in Mexico who have been ensnared in protracted hearings for entry to the U.S. and have lost shelter because of the pandemic.
https://t.co/jHYefQYLNp

name: NPR
text:
Volkswagen and Porsche have finished paying out $9.5 billion to defrauded U.S. car owners over the emissions scandal ‚Äî in what was the largest false advertising action ever taken by the FTC.
https://t.co/I0K7191EML

name: NPR
text:
Congressional Republicans unveiled their $1 trillion proposal for a new wave of pandemic relief, which includes slashing the $600 weekly jobless benefit to $200. 

Democrats are not on board ‚Äî signaling tough negotiations ahead.
https://t.co/6tzrg9enpk

name: NPR
text: A St. Louis school district is using a summer program to test an in-person school model for the fall ‚Äî including social distancing, strict mask protocol and an alternating day schedule. https://t.co/ypYW1F7XYN

name: NPR
text:
President Trump is getting out-polled in the suburbs.

He's using fear to try to win them back, but his view of the suburbs seems outdated. They've grown more diverse, and all-white neighborhoods are almost entirely gone. https://t.co/4LHivixhZP

name: NPR
text: Gov. Gavin Newsom announced a slate of new state and federal resources, including a $52 million investment, for California's Central Valley ‚Äî  where hospitals are inundated with coronavirus patients. https://t.co/Ndoy9B1Wtb

name: NPR
text:
The pandemic has led to a drop in ship traffic, which means the oceans are quieter ‚Äî a momentary relief for marine mammals.

Scientists are listening in and hoping to learn how whale communication is changing. üîäüêã
https://t.co/r58HhkIO9w

name: NPR
text:
The pandemic has made big international summits nearly impossible.

That could have a big impact on Joe Biden's approach to foreign policy, which is rooted in personal connections, forged over long and repeated face-to-face meetings.
https://t.co/nHQwy6YVVJ

name: NPR
text: Mexican media reported several deaths Hurricane Hanna, including children who were swept away by currents during flooding. https://t.co/1WdXmIPc2n

name: NPR
text:
In a letter to Congress, 6 U.S. mayors criticize the Trump administration for sending "unidentified federal agents to operate with impunity" in cities with ongoing protests against police brutality and racism.
https://t.co/3ySoWOR3Ay

name: NPR
text:
Amid an epidemic of COVID-19 scams, sellers of dietary supplements have made unsubstantiated ‚Äî and potentially illegal ‚Äî claims that they can treat viruses.

Critics say Amazon has not done enough to police third-party sellers.
https://t.co/pFnlJuwQ6H

name: NPR
text: The price of gold soared nearly 30% ‚Äî and many analysts predict the price will head even higher as investors look for a "safe haven" amid the pandemic and rising U.S.-China tensions.  https://t.co/UrIukd1qIQ

name: NPR
text:
Pulitzer Prize winning poet Natasha Trethewey explores the lingering effects of her mother's murder.

"I have lived with the guilt that I am implicated in my mother's death ‚Äî or, more precisely that she is dead because I am not."
https://t.co/w3slK40h4e

name: NPR
text:
Researchers are developing tools to help control citrus greening, a disease killing thousands of acres of orange and grapefruit trees.

The solution may rest in a fruit most people have never heard of ‚Äî the Australian finger lime.
https://t.co/3y3Toci7FA

name: NPR
text:
With less than 100 days until Election Day, Biden has an advantage over Trump for now.

Here are 9 factors that could change the race before November, including:

üîπschool reopenings
üîπBiden's VP pick
üîπfundraising
üîπpotential surprises
 https://t.co/E9kFjUxNSV

name: NPR
text:
We crave time alone just like we crave time with others. 

But what‚Äôs the right amount of solitude? That varies person to person, but scientists say if you‚Äôre not getting enough time alone ‚Äî you may feel more irritable or anxious. 
https://t.co/VrGCMOi0r6

name: NPR
text: In Malawi, one of the world's poorest countries, counselors are guiding girls as they face tough choices during the pandemic ‚Äî such as giving up education for child marriage to ease economic strains.  https://t.co/dSsWSxFGhx

name: NPR
text:
In a new book, the Judiciary Committee special counsel during impeachment traces the process.

On President Trump, Norm Eisen says "He understands what he's doing. It is a pattern." https://t.co/kDqb2KkAjH

name: NPR
text:
Delta Air Lines is losing about $27 million a day. 

More than bailout money, CEO Ed Bastian says the industry needs the federal government to focus on halting the spread of the coronavirus. 
 https://t.co/V8ciWivQnl

name: NPR
text:
Comic Mike Birbiglia was initially reluctant to become a father, but his wife, Jen Stein, saw things things differently. 

The two have collaborated on a memoir exploring Birbiglia's ambivalence about parenthood. https://t.co/w0V8MrjSEd

name: NPR
text:
Andy Slavitt, former acting administrator of the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services, says trust could be a key issue in the fight against COVID-19.

"We see it in the presidential briefings and the inability to trust what we hear."
https://t.co/0ut9nDY14A
